# Assignment


::: {.cell hash='04_causality_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_c2bdc5d0b1156a11552d00cf1ce588cc'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Load necessary libraries
library(tidyverse)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
#> ── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
#> ✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.4
#> ✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.0
#> ✔ ggplot2   3.4.4     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
#> ✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.0
#> ✔ purrr     1.0.2     
#> ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
#> ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
#> ✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
#> ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(ggplot2)
```
:::

::: {.cell hash='04_causality_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_18b70e96400d45daf8d8af181372e0b8'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Set seed for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
```
:::

::: {.cell hash='04_causality_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_eb8e240cd28ceae0930afd3691ac9728'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Generate random data for two variables
n <- 50
x <- rnorm(n)
y <- 0.8*x + rnorm(n)
```
:::

::: {.cell hash='04_causality_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_19321d5d22193f94ebf4bc94d402231b'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Create a data frame
data <- data.frame(x = x, y = y)
```
:::

::: {.cell hash='04_causality_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_222af2f8cec6a3f15e854e309e63ac75'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Create a scatter plot with a regression line
ggplot(data, aes(x, y)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE, color = "blue") +
  labs(title = "Spurious Correlation",
       x = "X Variable",
       y = "Y Variable") +
  theme_minimal()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
#> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
```
:::
